Gutes game leider sehr schwer am Anfang aber nach den ersten paar 100 std wird es immer leichter.

Including console I have well over 300 hours in DBD. While at first glance it seems pretty basic, there are intricacies I am still learning. This game is so much fun if you put in the time to learn. The matchmaking is not always great in terms of pairing similarly skilled players, but the majority of games are still fun especially with friends. Developer is really good at adding exciting new content and events as well. 10/10 would definitely recommend.

The game is easy to learn but takes time to master. For new players I would maybe recommend to play survivor first with some more seasoned friends and/or take notes on some great streams and videos out there. 
There will be toxic players, trolls and hackers from time to time (like in every online game there is), but overall the gaming experience is very fun especially if you don't take your gaming too seriously. The game will be also rewarding for more competitive players when you're starting to learn the best tactics against which ever your opponent side is.
love the game tonz of fun.

Il gioco Ã¨ una vergogna, competitivo? ma dove? Il killer con gli ultimi aggiornamenti Ã¨ diventato troppo svantaggiato, non ho vinto una singola partita, gen rush iperveloce e pallet ovunque...unica nota positiva sono i dlc e basta, un'intossicazione nel giocare come killer che non immaginate, i survivors poi super tossici con 1500 ore alle spalle contro me di 700 ore, uno schifo. Poveri quelli che hanno appena iniziato a giocare e si beccano i rank rossi contro mascherati dal rank cenere, sono tentato nel disinstallarlo ma ci ho speso troppo.

This game was truly designed to allow players have the most fun. The mechanics, the perk system, the rankings have been polished to a point where this game could be considered close to perfect. 666 hours that I've spent playing it weren't wasted, in fact, I learned more about myself in the post-game lobby chat through player-friendly feedback from the fellow DBD fans. Whoever came up with the idea for the game, thank you so much for making this world a better place.

DBD is a fantastic game concept. You can play alone as killer and be in charge of your gameplay, mistakes and wins. Or you can play as survivor, to try and succeed as a team, best with friends. 

However, recently I've experienced an increased number of obvious cheaters. Things like floating through the air, jumping high into the sky, hooking unhooking themselves and healing health states just like that. I also encounter a lot of "soft" cheating, where things are a bit too "quick", mostly things like movement speed or how you quickly you get detected. Obviously there is no direct proof, but if you play the game long enough and check perks and profiles there are some fair guesses.

I can put up with imbalances in the game due to add-ons and what not, borderline exploiting mechanics by either survivor or killer and so on. I can however not with cheaters and especially the inability to easily do something about it. The in game report system does not seem to fruit and blocking is unless as well, you will still get matched.

This makes any progress and status you have in the game almost meaningless, if things can go that easily by the anti cheat, what is an high rank or a high mmr worth? 

Well for me, it has come to the point where my motivation to play the game has significantly reduced, and since there seems not recognition or any mention of addressing this issue, I do not foresee this changing.

Cheers
match making is horrible ....all of a sudden i am with survivor teams or top level survivoprs and its a 0 kill for me as a killer

(i play on another platform) When you play this game you're gonna become either a killer player and get depression bc of infinite hate for no reason at all, or you're gonna be a survivor player and think it is ok to make the game unfun for killer players just for you to bully someone with the excuse that their are an evil character in a videogame and not an actual human being trying to have fun.

Devs are largely lazy and incompetent, with no incentive to improve the game and the grind. 
There are close to 100 perks for both sides, that have to be bought with in-game currency THREE times for EACH CHARACTER and thats just the start of the Bullshit. And in the Latest QnA they said they are not going to improve it anytime soon.
They have EVERY SINGLE MONETIZATION type. You have to buy the game, you can then buy the DLC and also cosmetics. They are making money hand over fist.
Maybe if people stop buying and playing the game they will pull their thumbs out their asses and do some competent work, if they are even capable of that.
Edit: They have said they are addressing the grind, when its implemented we'll see
good but too much cheaters and bugs and non-balance things.

Awesome game. Does not get boring. Except when the killers are camping. :) Also very nice to play with friends. They also keep updating with new maps and characters. You also get specials coins to buy them. So you don't necessarily need to spend money on it.

This game can be very fun. I would recommend the game IF you can not take it too seriously. There are perks and things you can do as both a killer and survivor that can be frustrating. Please just move on a try not to take it too seriously. Sometimes you will run into people who are toxic in chat, as with most games. Try your best to just ignore them and move on. If you want great killer tips watch Otzdarva. While you're at it subscribe to them. Otz is incredibly nice and is funny. Even if you don't end up playing the game Otz is still great to watch.

i keep getting tunnelled and it is not a fun time

As much as I love this game and play it with my friends this game is starting to get a worse toxic fandom than LoL has. The game rewards killers for being toxic, slugging, camping, tunneling...etc. It allows them to get to high ranks by playing badly. The people at the top tend to be more rude and mean than the people at the bottom. Worst of all the company seems to not care. It caters specifically to killer players and keeps making them easier to play and rewards them for being unsportsmanlike. They don't take reports into account and because of that nobody is afraid to be reported. The new ranking system allows people to get higher faster and because of that it inflates their ego's and allows them to keep being mean. This game has lost its element of fun. I really hope the devs fix this game and allow survivors to actually enjoy this game.

Every update seems to add some new system to the game or overhauls a current system that just worsens the play experience. 

The new matchmaking system sucks. Yes, rewarding players that reach a red rank each month is nice and all, but why did BHVR have to add an MMR system on top of it, to where if your pushing rank, and the better your doing, you will only be placed against people sweating, for killers and survivors.  Another thing to note is how even then, if thats not an issue for you, they couldnt even make the MMR system right at all, as it doesnt even accurately reflect skillful gameplay at times, as for survivor, if you life, you gain mmr, you die, you it. You can actively sit in a bush the entire game and be a detriment to your team the entire time, but hatch escape, and you gain mmr. For killer, its kills. you get 2 kills you stay even, less you lose, more you gain. You can have people suicide of first 1, or camp and have 2 kills at 2 hooks and be not lose mmr, hell even gain it some matches. It is toxic game design, it pushes the playerbase to play in manners that is unfun for both sides, like excessively sweaty, face camping, tunnelling, gen rushing, doing literallly nothing to get hatch escape, etc etc. 

The way the devs handle balancing and adding new perks and killers into this game is horrible as well. When a new set of perks/killer come into the game, it will likely have one perk that is seriously overtuned, one perk that doesnt work as intended, and one that is a joke and you question why it was added to begin with. Killer design is the same way, though mainly in the doesnt work as intended category. The last year of perk design and rebalance though has thoroughly ruined the game for me though. Who thought boon totems were a good idea, or rather, why are they as strong as they are with not much counter play. Who thought that Hex: Undying when it initially came out was a good idea and then kept it like that for as long as they did? Why did it take 5 years for an abused perk to get tuned to still be usable and very strong for what it does in Decisive Strike? Why did it take so long for Trapper to be allowed to use more than one trap in his hand by default and to rework the countless horrible addons that existed in the game? The list goes on and on. 

The final reason not to play this game is the community. The community of this game are some of the most toxic people and some of the biggest cry babies across the internet. If you play killer and that is what you enjoy and you get good at it, prepare to endure racism, misogyny, DCing, toxic sweating, people complaining that you broke unwritten rules and that they shouldve lived, and hack allogations. Say the coins reversed, youll experience racism, misogyny, DCing, toxic sweati... oh wait, its the exact same. Because neither side, killer or survivor, is content to just accept what they have and have fun with it. Both sides have been molded to play in an entitled manner, where both sides feel like every single god forsaken update is ripping something desperately needed out from under them and now they wont 4k at 5 gen or gen rush get out with all 4 with less than 4 hooks across the board. Its pathetic. and nothing is being done to combat it besides a couple bigger individuals in the community, but it doesnt help when a large chunk of its active influencer community fuels the tire fire.

Dont buy this game. Save your Sanity. You wont be Dead by Daylight if you dont succumb to the night in the first place

Honestly, I've been into DBD for a long time but haven't been able to keep with it as my brain just hyerfocus' on random game and right now this is a hyper fixation. I honestly got more into it after watching a twitch streamer/youtube known as SpookyLoopz. He helped me get back into a game I already liked a lot. But, anyway. Gameplay is super entertaining and since there are different killers and different survivors, it feels playable over and over again. The game, while the objectives stay the same, the gameplay never does. It's always unpredictable and not every tactic will work and I love that. The perks allow for that and plus how people play. I love it so much and honestly recommend it to anyone who likes horror games and likes co-op games. Really good game.

as a deaf player, I am disappointed in this game's lack of a visible heartbeat cue. I am aware that the mobile app and this game are run by different teams (so I was informed when I submitted a ticket), but the ticket was also submitted over a year ago with empty promises of progress being made on this feature being implemented. I will keep this review as negative until the feature is added for fellow deaf/HoH players alongside players who just can't have sound on for whatever reason.
Great game to have fun in. You can meet some of the nicest people ever.
